channel.title: Compile javac: file not found: *.java
channel.description: Whenever I try to load my compile in my server folder, it says this: [code]javac: file not found: *.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options[/code] Can anyone please help me and tell me a solution? I've been looking around all day for one and have yet to find one. Pretty sure my JDK version is correct. I believe it is 1.6.0_31. Also, I've done everything right in my Environmental Variables I believe. Thanks.

item.title: Compile javac: file not found: *.java
item.dc:creator: @imstrength imstrength
item.description:
@imstrength wrote:

EvoIllusions:

I stick to the words witch I have spoken.

this…what he has told you is correct. you need to set you’re E table

Read full topic

item.title: Compile javac: file not found: *.java

item.title: Compile javac: file not found: *.java
item.dc:creator: @PouchOfLemons PouchOfLemons
item.description:
@PouchOfLemons wrote:

[quote=“EvoIllusions, post:4, topic:463843”]To reset your Environmental Tabs, go to your start menu and type ‘environment’ choose system environment, then go to ‘E` Variables’ you will be editing CLASSPATH & path/Path.

With the CMDs just replace it’s Java with yours.

(If this is hard for you, you really shouldn’t be doing this until you complete step four.)[/quote]
I already replaced it’s Java with mine, it still doesn’t work. It can’t find *.java which is what it is supposed to find for the server compiler.

Read full topic

item.title: Compile javac: file not found: *.java
item.dc:creator: @EvoIllusions EvoIllusions
item.description:
@EvoIllusions wrote:

To reset your Environmental Tabs, go to your start menu and type ‘environment’ choose system environment, then go to ‘E` Variables’ you will be editing CLASSPATH & path/Path.

With the CMDs just replace it’s Java with yours.

(If this is hard for you, you really shouldn’t be doing this until you complete step four.)

Read full topic

item.title: Compile javac: file not found: *.java
item.dc:creator: @PouchOfLemons PouchOfLemons
item.description:
@PouchOfLemons wrote:

[quote=“EvoIllusions, post:2, topic:463843”][quote author=PouchOfLemons link=topic=567529.msg4122987#msg4122987 date=1349992147]
Whenever I try to load my compile in my server folder, it says this:

javac: file not found: *.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options
Can anyone please help me and tell me a solution? I’ve been looking around all day for one and have yet to find one. Pretty sure my JDK version is correct. I believe it is 1.6.0_31. Also, I’ve done everything right in my Environmental Variables I believe. Thanks.
[/quote]
Lmao.
Step one, update Java & JDK.
Step two, reset your ETabs. Step three, Correct your CMD files. Step four, [url=http://lmgtfy.com/?q=the+big+index]Learn to code.[/url][/quote] Can you tell me how to reset my E Tabs and how to correct my CMD files? Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Compile javac: file not found: *.java
item.dc:creator: @EvoIllusions EvoIllusions
item.description:
@EvoIllusions wrote:

[quote=“PouchOfLemons, post:1, topic:463843”]Whenever I try to load my compile in my server folder, it says this:

javac: file not found: *.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options
Can anyone please help me and tell me a solution? I’ve been looking around all day for one and have yet to find one. Pretty sure my JDK version is correct. I believe it is 1.6.0_31. Also, I’ve done everything right in my Environmental Variables I believe. Thanks.[/quote]
Lmao.
Step one, update Java & JDK.
Step two, reset your E` Tabs.
Step three, Correct your CMD files.
Step four, Learn to code.

Read full topic
